title: Provide complete project code (frontend + backend) in chat as an Export alternative

requirements.text: Deliver the complete project source code (frontend + backend) directly in the chat as a Basic-plan alternative to the platform "Export Code" button, in a copy/paste-friendly format that a developer can recreate locally in VS Code.
acceptanceCriteria: The chat output includes BOTH the frontend and backend code for the project.
The code is organized file-by-file, where each file output clearly indicates the exact relative path (e.g., `backend/main.mo`, `frontend/src/App.tsx`) followed by the full file contents.
The file listing is complete enough that a developer can reconstruct the repository locally and run it using the existing documented commands.
Any user-facing text included in the delivered code/files or instructions is in English.

requirements.text: Include clear, step-by-step instructions (in chat) for reconstructing the project locally from the pasted files, installing dependencies, configuring environment variables using the existing example `.env` files, and running the app in VS Code.
acceptanceCriteria: Instructions include where to create folders/files, how to verify the directory structure matches the provided paths, and how to paste contents safely.

Instructions reference the existing example env files (e.g., `frontend/.env.example`, `frontend/.env.development.example`, `frontend/.env.staging.example`) and explain how to create the real `.env` file(s) from them.
Instructions include copy-paste-ready commands to install dependencies and start the frontend and backend for local development.
All instruction text is in English.

constraints: Do not modify any files under immutable frontend paths: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with logic in `backend/main.mo`; only introduce `backend/migration.mo` if state migration is required.
nonGoals: Adding new product features or changing the existing application behavior/UI as part of this request.
Providing or requiring access to the platform UI "Export Code" feature (the user is on the Basic plan).
Integrating any third-party services (payments, email, external auth, analytics, etc.).
